qas.question: Who published IBM's first equal opportunity policy letter?
In what year was IBM's first equal opportunity policy letter published?
In 1961 IBM's nondiscrimination policy was expanded to include what?
How many inventors were honored at IBM's first Invention Award Dinner?
Starting in 1963 IBM started a program by naming 8 of these.

plausible_answers.text: the company's first written equal opportunity policy letter

qas.question: What was published by the Board of Education in 1952?

plausible_answers.text: nondiscrimination policy was expanded to include sex, national origin, and age

qas.question: What did the judgement in Brown vs. Board of Education cause to be added to IBM hiring policy in 1952?
How many people were involved in the Brown vs. Board of Education case?
What was hosted by the Board of Education for the first time in 1962?

context: In <a1_0>1952<a1_0/>, <a0_0>Thomas J. Watson, Jr<a0_0/>., published <b5_0>the company's first written equal opportunity policy letter<b5_0/>, one year before the U.S. Supreme Court decision in Brown vs. Board of Education and 11 years before the <b8_0>Civil Rights Act<b8_0/> of 1964. In 1961, IBM's <b6_0>nondiscrimination policy was expanded to include <a2_0>sex, national origin, and age<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The following year, IBM hosted its first <b9_0>Invention Award Dinner<b9_0/> honoring <a3_0><b7_0>34<b7_0/><a3_0/> outstanding IBM inventors; and in 1963, the company named the first eight <a4_0>IBM Fellows<a4_0/> in a new Fellowship Program that recognizes senior IBM scientists, engineers and other professionals for outstanding technical achievements.
